general_advisory: In view of five days weather forecast received from IMD, farmers can resume agronomic practices and application of fertilizer. Farmers are advised to apply pesticides with a sticker by keeping in view of real-time weather conditions. Apply balanced and appropriate fertilizers according to the cropâ€™s growth stage. Avoid excess nitrogen as it promotes excessive vegetative growth and increases water demand. Always consider an integrated approach of preventive measures together with biological treatment if available to protect the crop from pests.

advisory: Farmers are advised to spray of leaf extracts of Bael, Tulsi, or Neem per litre of water for reducing the incidence of insects & diseases.
Current weather is favorable for blast infestation. If leaf blast is observed in the rice field, spray Tebuconazole + Trifloxystrobin or Isoprothiolane.
There is a chance of infestation of sheath rot and sheath blight in paddy. Spray Tebuconazole + Trifloxystrobin or Propiconazole by mixing with water.
Presently BLB infestation has been observed in a few places. Spray Copper oxychloride + Streptocycline to control BLB.
Application of plant hormone Planofix is advisable at 60-65 DAS for improving the seed cotton yield.
Apply glyphosate or Glufosinate Ammonium to control all types of weeds.
Apply the second top dressing of urea at 60 DAS.
Apply Magnesium sulphate mixed with urea in waterlogged areas to reduce leaf reddening.
Apply Neem-based pesticide to control sucking pests complex like Aphid, Jassids, Thrips & Whitefly.
Drench the soil with Carbendazim for soil-borne diseases.
To control leaf webber infestation, spray Profenophos or Chlorpyriphos.
Monitor your field regularly for signs of pest infestation. Sucking pest infestation may be seen, to prevent it, spray neem-based pesticide at the initial stage of infestation.
Apply Metiram at the root zone of the plant to prevent wilting.
Apply Urea if the crop is at tasseling stage and irrigate if water is not sufficient.
Monitor the field regularly for stem borer, FAW, and banded leaf and sheath blight. Remove infected plant parts and apply appropriate pesticides.
Apply Emamectin Benzoate to control FAW infestation.
For BLSB, spray Validamycin or Hexaconazole to control it.
Install yellow sticky traps to monitor sucking pests.
To prevent wilting, spray Tebuconazole at the root zone.
Install Blue sticky traps to monitor thrips infestation.
If thrips symptoms are seen, spray neem-based pesticide at the initial stage of infestation.
Raising tomato seedlings is suitable at this time with specific varieties and seed rates mentioned.
Give concentrate to dairy animals as grasses may be high in moisture during rainy days.
Keep dry fodder and straw ready for sheep and goat in the rainy season.
Ensure balanced concentrate for sheep and goat one month prior to kidding and lambing.
Clean poultry houses daily and change feed and water frequently.
Do not bring poultry birds or eggs from affected areas.
